#Text=Uber London to lose operator licence after September
#Text=Monday , September 25 , 2017

#Text=On Friday , Transport for London ( TfL ) announced US -based taxi booking application Uber would not get a renewed private hire operator license after their current permit expires at the end of the month .
#Text=The regulatory body released an official statement on their website and stated Uber London Limited was " not fit and proper to hold a private hire operator license " .
#Text=TfL said Uber London " demonstrate[d ] a lack of corporate responsibility " for reporting serious criminal offences , and for obtaining background of the drivers and medical certificates .

column1: #Text=In August , police said Uber allowed a driver despite allegations of sexually assaulting a passenger .
#Text=The company has been accused of sexism and bullying .
#Text=TfL in its statement also complained about possible use of " greyball " software to prevent officials from accessing the application for law enforcement duties .

column1: #Text=According to Uber 's statistics , about 3.5 million people in London use Uber .
#Text=There are some 40 thousand drivers tied with Uber within the British capital .
#Text=Per the Private Hire Vehicles ( London ) Act 1998 , Uber can appeal against TfL 's decision within three weeks .
#Text=Uber received an interim renewal for four months in May , and it is set to expire at the end of the month .

#Text=To this announcement , Uber London 's General Manager Tom Elvidge said , " By wanting to ban our app from the capital Transport for London and the Mayor have caved in to a small number of people who want to restrict consumer choice .

#Text=To defend the livelihoods of all those drivers , and the consumer choice of millions of Londoners who use our app , we intend to immediately challenge this in the courts .

_	_	_	_

#Text=He also added ,  This ban would show the world that , far from being open , London is closed to innovative companies who bring choice to consumers . "

column1: #Text=TfL said Uber 's irresponsibility could compromise the safety and security of the public .
#Text=In contrast , Uber 's response said their service enhances safety .

#Text=London mayor Sadiq Khan , on Facebook , said , " [ ... ]all companies in London must play by the rules and adhere to the high standards we expect — particularly when it comes to the safety of customers .

#Text=Regarding the complaint about improper use of use of Greyball , Elvidge cited an independent review and said it  found that ' greyball ' has never been used or considered in the UK for the purposes cited by TfL " .

column1: #Text=Uber operates in over 40 cities and towns in the UK .
